comments.author: zac vucemillo

comments.text:
+Lumpy TopHat Yeah I've thought a lot about this as I am a huge Attack on 
Titan fan, its hard to imagine still, 1 Trigger is for the gas propelling 
the hook while simultaneously unreeling the cable (To avoid loss of 
momentum from friction while the hook is pulling on the cable). And then 
the 2nd trigger to initiate the reeling in of the Cable (Allowing you to 
pull yourself towards the hooks destination). And lastly Pulling on Trigger 
1 while Trigger 2 is already depressed would release the hook from where it 
punctured the wall allowing the hook to come back to you while the Cable is 
still being reeled in when your still in motion.

I would assume you would have to make a way for the pressurized gas to 
assist in the reeling in on the cable to allow fast enough movement when 
pulling the person towards the object, otherwise the maneuvers of only 
using 1 of the hooks seems unreasonable.

And as stated already the biggest problem is making the hook capable of 
penetrating concrete, the amount of force required to shoot this heavy duty 
hook and the weight of the cable (Depending on material) fast enough to 
reach your target, without its speed being hindered too greatly, would be 
so ridiculous you probably would be blown back onto your ass every time you 
shot the cable out while standing on the ground. Not to mention when your 
airborne and you don't shoot the hooks simultaneously you'll spin 180 
degrees every time on the side you shot from first. And you would have to 
be ridiculously accurate to hit targets dead on otherwise the hook will 
just bounce off the wall or whatever it was you were trying to hook into.

And Lastly, being hopeful enough that the impact of the hook doesn't 
completely obliterate the wall you were trying to hook onto from the force 
of the shot so that while in motion you don't suddenly begin falling to the 
ground.

LASTLY LASTLY! - I was wondering what would happen if you traveled past the 
hook and then retracted it, ever retracted a tape measure from far away and 
it swing around hitting you in the arm or face? Yeah imagine a heavy duty 
hook smacking you in the stomach or arm? HMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM.

I guess it would be more like a Spear head with 4 arms that would be able 
to spread out when in the wall and then retract when reeling it in....

I believe I may be over thinking this a bit much.
comments.author: rmyd027

comments.text:
well considering the titans are made of light/ energy it's entirely 
possible, since they're made of light they shouldn't collapse under their 
own weight

comments.author: Lumpy TopHat

comments.text:
+Lumpy TopHat If you have looked at the swords you can see different 
buttons on them. Which "can" mean that one can be held down for gas and the 
other can be held down for the hooks to fire and when you release the 
button for the hooks it will make the arms on the hook fold in and then i 
will just slip out and reel in.
comments.author: BearNotGrylls

comments.text:
+zac vucemillo
Those may be strong materials but like you said, they aren't accurate. And 
we don't have any way as of yet (Don't quote me on this) to store a compact 
gas with enough propulsion force to fire individual hooks that pierce 
walls. And the biggest problem is that we aren't told a clear on how the 
hooks in the SHOW (Not Manga) unhook from walls and rewind themselves so 
quickly and prepare themselves for another hookshot a second later. :/
comments.author: Lumpy TopHat

comments.text:
+Lumpy TopHat
 
what about Hagfish slime. I bet if that stuff was nano-synthesized and then 
spiral braided it might be able to take the newtons and force for at least 
a small person. Plus if we have steel cables that can pull trucks out of 
mud then I think a lot of them could pull a person. It would be way too 
dangerous though. I think the harder thing would be ensuring the hook shots 
were actually securely lodged would be a major factor. When you rock climb 
you have to be very careful where you put the anchors so I would think that 
just shooting them randomly into something and then pulling at them with 
enough force to fling a human just would not hold them in place. The whole 
thing is way too dangerous.
comments.author: zac vucemillo

comments.text:
Do you think giant nude men eating humans is possible? Or are you talking 
about the 3dmg gear. Since the shooting individual hooks with a sort of 
pistol trigger on a sword hilt is possible and can be made home made, but 
as of now there aren't any strong enough materials that are compact enough 
to pull a human towards a destined location using advanced maneuvers. So 
not really :P

captions.text:
Put that Mega Man E-Mug down on a Marvel Comic
table because I'm Jake and this is episode
#26 of Game LUT.

Grab your Rapture backpack and take out your
Papers, Please...notebooks and you should

probably take out this insane Fallout 3 Laser
Rifle replica. Now you have room for an Attack

on Titan lunch box so you can eat snacks while
you 3D print a Game Boy. This DIY project

from Adafruit uses a raspberry pi, hacked
super nintendo controller and a custom 3D

printed case so you can load emulators onto
it and play any retro game your lil' heart
desires.

If you don't feel like building a game boy,
you could always buy a custom painted Game

Boy Advance. Make sure people know these portables
are yours by marking them with an Assassin's

Creed branding lighter attachment. Or stay
at home with your 8bit covered floor, Minecraft

wall decals that give of the illusion of being
3 dimensional, lay on a pile of Mega Evolution

Pokemon plush toys and play on the Hyperkin
RetroN 5. It plays *clears throat* Famicom,

Super Famicom, Nintendo, Super Nintendo, Game
Boy, Game Boy Color, Game Boy Advance, Sega

Genesis and Sega Mega Drive Games.
After staying at a screen, stare at some awesome
prints by The Beast is Back...

Before leaving your home make sure all systems
are operational with Faster Than Light pins

and unlock your best self using a Hearthstone
arena key or, if you're old school, use the

Konami code...necklace. Now that you're ready
to rock, get out of that Captain America robe,

put on a glow in the dark Hydra shirt, black
mesa bracelet, 4 star dragon ball necklace

and Aiden's coat from Watch Dogs. Or if you
want to be a matching couple grab a Majora's

Mask shirt and a really cool Hyrule Dress
by Koala Art & Design. If you get cold you

can throw on this Legend of Zelda hoodie.
If the ladies neck is feeling naked, you can

get a TMNT acrylic mask necklace and for the
gentleman there is a Batman bowtie, because

bowties are cool. Isn't that right Doctor
Who...electrical outlet decal?

Now slip on your Harley Quinn flats and protect
yourself from Minecraft Skeletons, Squids

and Enderman plushes with a Mega Man Blaster
replica. It has built in lights and sounds

so you can fire a single shot or, for a little
more power, a charged one. If you find yourself

outnumbered use this Ryuko (ree-uko) figure
from KILL la KILL. Or for a less bloody battle

try putting on a tanooki suit...mario figure.
After defeating evil, show your strength with
some Pokemon Gym Badge prints by Azafran...

But if you're a real BFG then rock this insanely
cool 3D DOOM covert art sculpture...

A lot of people asked me on instagram where
I got my Attack on Titan Scouting Legion shirt,

Look Human has it and links to all the LUT
can be found in the description below.

title: Build Your Own Game Boy! -- Game LÜT #26
